verses.verse: And Saul <S%H7586><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Jonathan <S%H3129><s%> his son <S%H1121><s%>, and to all his servants <S%H5650><s%>, that they should kill <S%H4191><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>.

But Jonathan <S%H3083><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%>'s son <S%H1121><s%> delighted <S%H2654><s%> much <S%H3966><s%> in David <S%H1732><s%>: and Jonathan <S%H3083><s%> told <S%H5046><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Saul <S%H7586><s%> my father <S%H1><s%> seeks <S%H1245><s%> to kill <S%H4191><s%> you <S%H8104><s%>: now therefore, I pray you, take care to yourself until the morning <S%H1242><s%>, and stay <S%H3427><s%> in a secret <S%H5643><s%> place <S%H2244><s%>, and hide yourself:

And I will go out <S%H3318><s%> and stand <S%H5975><s%> beside <S%H3027><s%> my father <S%H1><s%> in the field <S%H7704><s%> where you are <S%H1696><s%>, and I will talk with my father <S%H1><s%> about you <S%H4100><s%>; and what I see <S%H7200><s%>, that I will tell you <S%H5046><s%>.

And Jonathan <S%H3083><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%> unto Saul <S%H7586><s%> his father <S%H1><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H4428><s%>, Let not the king sin <S%H2398><s%> against his servant <S%H5650><s%>, against David <S%H1732><s%>; because he has not sinned <S%H2398><s%> against you <S%H4639><s%>, and because his works have been toward you very <S%H3966><s%> good <S%H2896><s%>:

For he did put <S%H7760><s%> his life <S%H5315><s%> in his hand <S%H3709><s%>, and killed <S%H5221><s%> the Philistine <S%H6430><s%>, and the Lord <S%H3068><s%> worked <S%H6213><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> salvation <S%H8668><s%> for all Israel <S%H3478><s%>: you saw <S%H7200><s%> it <S%H8055><s%>, and did rejoice: why then will you sin <S%H2398><s%> against innocent <S%H5355><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%>, to kill <S%H4191><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> without a cause <S%H2600><s%>?

And Saul <S%H7586><s%> listened <S%H8085><s%> unto the voice <S%H6963><s%> of Jonathan <S%H3083><s%>: and Saul <S%H7586><s%> swore <S%H7650><s%>, As the Lord <S%H3068><s%> lives <S%H2416><s%>, he shall not <S%H518><s%> be slain <S%H4191><s%>.

And Jonathan <S%H3083><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>, and Jonathan <S%H3083><s%> showed <S%H5046><s%> him all those things <S%H1697><s%>. And Jonathan <S%H3083><s%> brought <S%H935><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> to Saul <S%H7586><s%>, and he was in his presence <S%H6440><s%>, as in times past <S%H865><s%>.

And there was war <S%H4421><s%> again <S%H3254><s%>: and David <S%H1732><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%>, and fought <S%H3898><s%> with the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>, and killed <S%H5221><s%> them with a great <S%H1419><s%> slaughter <S%H4347><s%>; and they fled <S%H5127><s%> from him <S%H6440><s%>.

And the evil <S%H7451><s%> spirit <S%H7307><s%> from the Lord <S%H3068><s%> was upon Saul <S%H7586><s%>, as he sat <S%H3427><s%> in his house <S%H1004><s%> with his javelin <S%H2595><s%> in his hand <S%H3027><s%>: and David <S%H1732><s%> played <S%H5059><s%> with his hand <S%H3027><s%>.

And Saul <S%H7586><s%> sought <S%H1245><s%> to strike <S%H5221><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> even to the wall <S%H7023><s%> with the javelin <S%H2595><s%>; but he slipped away <S%H6362><s%> out of Saul <S%H7586><s%>'s presence <S%H6440><s%>, and he struck <S%H5221><s%> the javelin <S%H2595><s%> into the wall <S%H7023><s%>: and David <S%H1732><s%> fled <S%H5127><s%>, and escaped <S%H4422><s%> that night <S%H3915><s%>.

Saul <S%H7586><s%> also sent <S%H7971><s%> messengers <S%H4397><s%> unto David <S%H1732><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>, to watch <S%H8104><s%> him <S%H4191><s%>, and to kill him in the morning <S%H1242><s%>: and Michal <S%H4324><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>'s wife <S%H802><s%> told <S%H5046><s%> him <S%H559><s%>, saying, If you save <S%H4422><s%> not your life <S%H5315><s%> to night <S%H3915><s%>, to morrow <S%H4279><s%> you shall be slain <S%H4191><s%>.
So Michal <S%H4324><s%> let <S%H3381><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> through a window <S%H2474><s%>: and he went <S%H3212><s%>, and fled <S%H1272><s%>, and escaped <S%H4422><s%>.

And Michal <S%H4324><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> an image <S%H8655><s%>, and laid <S%H7760><s%> it in the bed <S%H4296><s%>, and put <S%H7760><s%> a pillow <S%H3523><s%> of goats <S%H5795><s%>' hair for his head piece <S%H4763><s%>, and covered <S%H3680><s%> it with a cloth <S%H899><s%>.
And when Saul <S%H7586><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> messengers <S%H4397><s%> to take <S%H3947><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>, she said <S%H559><s%>, He is sick <S%H2470><s%>.

And Saul <S%H7586><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> the messengers <S%H4397><s%> again to see <S%H7200><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Bring him up <S%H5927><s%> to me in the bed <S%H4296><s%>, that I may kill him <S%H4191><s%>.

And when the messengers <S%H4397><s%> were come in <S%H935><s%>, behold <S%H8655><s%>, there was an image in the bed <S%H4296><s%>, with a pillow <S%H3523><s%> of goats <S%H5795><s%>' hair for his head <S%H4763><s%>.

And Saul <S%H7586><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Michal <S%H4324><s%>, Why have you deceived me so <S%H7411><s%>, and sent away <S%H7971><s%> my enemy <S%H341><s%>, that he is escaped <S%H4422><s%>? And Michal <S%H4324><s%> answered <S%H559><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%>, He said <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H7971><s%>, Let me go; why should I kill you <S%H4191><s%>?

So David <S%H1732><s%> fled <S%H1272><s%>, and escaped <S%H4422><s%>, and came <S%H935><s%> to Samuel <S%H8050><s%> to Ramah <S%H7414><s%>, and told <S%H5046><s%> him all that Saul <S%H7586><s%> had done <S%H6213><s%> to him <S%H8050><s%>. And he and Samuel went <S%H3212><s%> and lived <S%H3427><s%> in Naioth <S%H5121><s%>.
And it was told <S%H5046><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Behold <S%H1732><s%>, David is at Naioth <S%H5121><s%> in Ramah <S%H7414><s%>.

And Saul <S%H7586><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> messengers <S%H4397><s%> to take <S%H3947><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>: and when they saw <S%H7200><s%> the company <S%H3862><s%> of the prophets <S%H5030><s%> prophesying <S%H5012><s%>, and Samuel <S%H8050><s%> standing <S%H5975><s%> as appointed <S%H5324><s%> over them <S%H7307><s%>, the Spirit of God <S%H430><s%> was upon the messengers <S%H4397><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%>, and they also prophesied <S%H5012><s%>.

And when it was told <S%H5046><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%>, he sent <S%H7971><s%> other <S%H312><s%> messengers <S%H4397><s%>, and they prophesied <S%H5012><s%> likewise <S%H7586><s%>. And Saul sent <S%H7971><s%> messengers <S%H4397><s%> again <S%H3254><s%> the third <S%H7992><s%> time <S%H5012><s%>, and they prophesied also.

Then went <S%H3212><s%> he also to Ramah <S%H7414><s%>, and came <S%H935><s%> to a great <S%H1419><s%> well <S%H953><s%> that is in Sechu <S%H7906><s%>: and he asked <S%H7592><s%> and said <S%H559><s%>, Where <S%H375><s%> are Samuel <S%H8050><s%> and David <S%H1732><s%>? And one said <S%H559><s%>, Behold <S%H5121><s%>, they be at Naioth in Ramah <S%H7414><s%>.

And he went <S%H3212><s%> there to Naioth <S%H5121><s%> in Ramah <S%H7414><s%>: and the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> was upon him also <S%H3212><s%>, and he went on <S%H1980><s%>, and prophesied <S%H5012><s%>, until he came <S%H935><s%> to Naioth <S%H5121><s%> in Ramah <S%H7414><s%>.

And he stripped off <S%H6584><s%> his clothes <S%H899><s%> also <S%H1571><s%>, and prophesied <S%H5012><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Samuel <S%H8050><s%> in like manner <S%H5307><s%>, and lay down naked <S%H6174><s%> all that day <S%H3117><s%> and all that night <S%H3915><s%>. That is why they say <S%H559><s%>, Is Saul <S%H7586><s%> also among the prophets <S%H5030><s%>?
